analysis.Summary: Vue component that provides a reset-password form allowing users to request a password reset via phone (SMS) or email.
analysis.Purpose: To render the UI for selecting a reset method (phone or email), validate the input, dispatch a reset-password action, and navigate to the code-entry page.

Components.name: Tab
Components.responsibility: Displays selectable tabs for authentication methods and manages the selected tab state via v-model:selected.

Components.name: FieldPhone
Components.responsibility: Renders an international phone-input field with dial code and flag support, emits change events to update auth.state.user.phone.

Components.name: Field
Components.responsibility: Generic input component used here for email, bound via v-model:field to auth.state.user.email with validation.

Components.name: Button
Components.responsibility: Submit button that triggers onSubmit and then redirectTo on successful reset-password initiation.

Functions.name: onSubmit
Functions.purpose: Validates the phone or email based on the current tab, then calls auth.actions.resetPassword to initiate the reset flow.

Functions.name: redirectTo
Functions.purpose: Navigates to the 'Enter Code' route with query parameters indicating the method (phone or email) and flow type ('reset-password').

analysis.Usage: Imported as the ResetPassword view in the authentication router configuration. Rendered when the user navigates to the password-reset page/route.
Notes: The availableTabs computed filters out methods excluded by globals.state.options.auth.authMethodsExclude.
twofa store is imported but not directly used in this component.
Error handling in onSubmit rethrows a generic Error and logs failures; could be improved with user feedback.
Input validation uses a common inputsValidation.validateInputs helper with hardcoded Russian error messages.
Slide-fade CSS transitions are defined locally to animate tab content changes.
